itemDescription: British radio and television comedy scriptwriter

wikipedia_page.main: Bob Block (20 July 1921 – 17 April 2011) was a British radio and television comedy scriptwriter.

response: Writers included Jill Allgood, and Bob Block who created the BBC television series Rentaghost.
Pardon My Genie (1972–73) was a children's comedy series  produced by British ITV contractor Thames Television, and written by Bob Block who later created Rentaghost.

Galloping Galaxies! is a British children's television comedy series set on a spaceship that was shown on the BBC from October 1985 to December 1986, comprising two series, of ten episodes in total. It was created and written by Bob Block, the creator of Rentaghost. Jeremy Swan who directed Rentaghost, produced and directed the series. It featured Kenneth Williams in one of his final roles as the voice of the ship's bog-eyed computer, SID.

link_mentions.page: List of people from the London Borough of Ealing
response: *Bob Block (1921–2011), radio and television scriptwriter, lived in Madelely Road then Queen Anne's Grove, South Ealing from the late 1940s to 1996.
*Bob Block, 89, British comedy writer (Rentaghost, Life with The Lyons).

Our House was created by Norman Hudis, who was also the main writer. Two other writers contributed to the series, Brad Ashton and Bob Block. It was produced by Ernest Maxin. Episodes were recorded in front of a live audience at Teddington Studios. The theme music was composed by Maxin and performed by Johnny Gregory.
